title: Lake Billy Chinook Airport
text:
Lake Billy Chinook Airport, also known as Lake Billy Chinook State Airport, is a public use <a href="airport">airport</a> located six <a href="nautical%20mile">nautical mile</a>s (7 <a href="mile">mi</a>, 11 <a href="kilometre">km</a>) west of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="Culver%2C%20Oregon">Culver</a>, a city in <a href="Jefferson%20County%2C%20Oregon">Jefferson County, Oregon</a>, United States. The airport is privately owned, despite the name which might give the impression that it was owned by the state.
Facilities and aircraft.
Lake Billy Chinook Airport covers an area of 29 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (12 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 2,695 feet (821 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It has one <a href="runway">runway</a> designated 16/34 with an <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a> surface measuring 2,500 by 32 feet (762 x 10 m).
For the 12-month period ending April 13, 2010, the airport had 560 <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a> aircraft operations, an average of 46 per month. At that time there were 10 aircraft based at this airport: 90% single-<a href="aircraft%20engine">engine</a> and 10% multi-engine.
